text:
<@U01TBAF98H0>, the company's maturity is relatively low when it comes to inbound/content marketing. I almost do more explaining than content marketing :sweat_smile:.

Right now, I just prioritize the people that are excited about the opportunities content marketing provides. I just have way too little time to put up with BS or non-believers. I'm happy to explain to colleagues what content marketing can do, but if they don't get it, fine. There's enough people that do and luckily they tend to run the most succesfull functions in our org. Most of the work gets done by content agencies, if someone wants something, I'll ping my agency(ies), get the quote approved by the business unit bearing the costs and away we go. I mostly do orchestration, evangelization, strategy and process creation and mapping out the future.

<@U01U4QYQGMN>, nothing open at the moment, and if it was, it would be Amsterdam based. I expect us to be sort of remote post Covid, but not fully.

Most of the work gets done by content agencies, if someone wants something, I'll ping my agency(ies), get the quote approved by the business unit bearing the costs and away we go. I mostly do orchestration, evangelization, strategy and process creation and mapping out the future.
, nothing open at the moment, and if it was, it would be Amsterdam based. I expect us to be sort of remote post Covid, but not fully.

text: Hi everyone! I'm James Furbush, head of marketing at CueSquared in the Boston area. I found out about this group from <@U014RK24F9D> & <@UUXMCJQ15> when they shared a few Superpath articles in another marketing slack group we're all in. When I'm not working, I'm typically chasing my kids around or making homemade pizza.

text: Hello everyone. I am Toby Nwazor, the Content Marketing Lead at Millionaire Writers. I work with a team of writers and editors and we provide content writing, editing, ghostwriting, blog post writing, and web content writing services for digital marketing, crypto, and SaaS companies. I am available if you need any of my services. And I am excited to be here.

text: Hi everyone! I’m Megan Treacy and I’m a freelance Content Writer. My background is in journalism and blogging, specializing in technology and sustainability. I’ve moved into content marketing and I still love working with geeky content — that’s why my tagline is Creative Content for Geeks. I offer all the usual content writing services as well as executive ghostwriting for thought leadership content. I’m excited to be here and look forward to networking, learning and hopefully finding new client/gig leads as well. I’d love to connect on <https://www.linkedin.com/in/megantreacy/|LinkedIn> and <http://www.twitter.com/mtreacy|Twitter>, so don’t hesitate to add me there!

text: Hey folks! :smile: I'm Max, the editor at AppSumo. I work on our pun-tastic copy, blog posts, and UX writing. (On the side, I'm a TV and comic fanatic!) At AppSumo, we're always on the hunt for SEO writers and word wizards who can make entrepreneurship and software fun! So excited to connect with this amazing community and learn more from everyone.

elements.text: Hey folks!

I'm Max, the editor at AppSumo. I work on our pun-tastic copy, blog posts, and UX writing. (On the side, I'm a TV and comic fanatic!) At AppSumo, we're always on the hunt for SEO writers and word wizards who can make entrepreneurship and software fun! So excited to connect with this amazing community and learn more from everyone.

text: Tell me more about comics!

text: Some of my favorites in the superhero realm include Watchmen and Astonishing X-Men :superhero: but also really into graphic memoirs like Fun Home, Persepolis, and American Born Chinese. Also anything by Brian K. Vaughan has been gold for me (Saga, Paper Girls, Y: The Last Man, etc)

but also really into graphic memoirs like Fun Home, Persepolis, and American Born Chinese. Also anything by Brian K. Vaughan has been gold for me (Saga, Paper Girls, Y: The Last Man, etc)

text:
Hello y'all! I'm Rosemary, a freelance content writer. I've freelanced for 4 years now, and I'm looking at getting something permanent. It's been an amazing 4 years of experience freelancing, but I'm ready for a new chapter.
I also hope to learn from y'all, and play my part in making this community a better place.

If you have any question, don't hesitate to ask me. 
Stay thriving! :rocket:
